storyInfo: The 'Trilby Ashers' ascertain Amiya's status as the King of Sarkaz. Siege draws up plans to rouse Norport's citizens for self-salvation.

attributes.content: We're only a few hours away from the sunrise Miss Ines stipulated.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We need to hurry up the pace of our evacuation op.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Say, haven't you forgotten something even more important, Doctor of Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Yes, we and Dublinn are starting from the same line again.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Which means, time is of the essence.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: To forever abide by commitments is not solely what we ask of ourselves... but of those we make deals with, too.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've finally made it. I almost got offed by that Redsteel Guard boy.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Her Grace is very dissatisfied with your indolence. Your methods are too tepid.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Or is it that you're coaxing Alexandrina? Playing on her sympathies?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: That's a very grave accusation. I'm unconditionally loyal to Her Grace, that much is obvious, I'm just...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: We'll review your excuses in hindsight. For now, though, there's no time.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Stay put, Rhodes Islanders.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Arts in black... Just as the fresh intel described.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've kept it very well hidden, Rhodes Island. To think this Cautus is the Sarkaz's very Lord of Fiends.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Very interesting... Perhaps this is an issue that can't be solved without you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Poet, to not have recognized this is a further failure of your duties.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: By what means does Her Grace hope for me to remedy this?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: While you were chatting with Dublinn, we've had the position of the airship's dock confirmed. It's... treacherous in there.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But our fresh intel tells us the 'Lord of Fiends' will have some way to handle it.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: So, little Lord of Fiends, you'll cooperate with us, won't you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And what about that Windermere girl?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Forget trying to make up for things. The technology of the airship is our number one priority.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Think we've notified about everyone we could find.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: And that... caps off all we can do.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Amiya isn't back yet, and neither the Doctor nor Ines have been in touch.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Looks like somewhere's caught fire outside again.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: That's—where the hotel is.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We'd better go take a look.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Delphine? What are you sprinting like that for?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: —Where's that Rhodes Island lot?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I'll lay this out straight. Listen up, Alexandrina Vina Victoria.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Amiya and the Doctor got pushed by the 'Trilby Asher' into fulfilling that deal. They need to find the airship.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Duke Wellington's army is on this plate already. Afraid Duke Caster's reinforcements are here too.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They're all out to win the technology behind that Sarkaz airship. None of them will let their rivals have the advantage of getting it first.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Norport's become the dukes' wrestling ring.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hah. Surprising exactly no one.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: What about that broadcast? You know, pushing the dukes into officially attacking this place—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Miss Ines says she'll do all she can to make it happen.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: To what? What are you telling us?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: She says, she needs until sunrise.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Assuming the dukes go with direct confrontation after all, how much time do we still have?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As long as Miss Ines succeeds... the Duke of Windermere's high-speed warship should be approaching not long after the sun comes up.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You've got a hell of a lot of people gathered here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The people who aren't here probably already got the news. Anyone who does want to come with us'll keep with the procession.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: So I suggest before the Duke's warship officially encroaches, we continue to wait here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: With the present circumstances... going out in the street's not a good idea.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Doesn't matter if it's Wellington or Caster, they won't hold back against anyone they think's in the way.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No. We're best off leaving now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Sarkaz barracks around the barricade wall got ambushed. Odds are more than likely some duke's forces did it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We should get as close as we can to the part of the wall that's thin on defenses, while it's still night.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: More importantly... we need to let them all know, everyone still peeping out from behind their windows, that what we said was true.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This evacuation isn't some scheme to nab the last of their reserves. It's not some Sarkaz trap to wipe them out.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Reestablishing trust is a challenge, and the one and only way to do it—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Is for them to see real action.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Here, the books you asked me for last time.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: I had to spend an age searching in those Londinium libraries, not even knowing Victorian. Grabbed some poor Feline in the end to find your stuff.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sometimes I see you writing and drawing in this blank book too.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: You don't just read, you write your own stuff too?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: I've never been to Kazdel, but I hear they've got a whole Sarkaz university underground there.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Are you a teacher there?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: No, I'm just like you. Putting my life up for sale.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Are these books really that fun to read?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: They all end fine enough, but similar events keep happening over and over.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: All the authors can do is keep writing fine enough endings.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And I've gotten sick of it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: General Manfred made us lock you in here, but hasn't given any further orders since...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: How did you offend him?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Maybe, he just thought jail would be more peaceful for me.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's easier in here... to do whatever I'd actually like to do.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And that's reading?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: You really are a boring guy, then.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: I hear... us Sarkaz are going to get some real good news, real soon.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: So good it'll stun the entire land!
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: It's just going to be another war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Has anyone ever told you you're a drag to talk to?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Honestly, yeah.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Seriously... what a drag.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Alright, I'm changing shifts. You behave in here.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Don't forget, you promised to pay me for the books—
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: The Royal Court soldier's silhouette disappears with a wobble into the end of the prison corridor, and very soon, a different set of footsteps comes into earshot.
Hoederer waits.
But there is only quiet.
The crew are all aboard the airship now.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Paprika.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Urk... Here!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Have you ever read a book called... A History of Sarkaz War?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You should. I have a copy in my drawer. You can take it.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Is it a very fancy story?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: It is a history annals.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You said that already...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Then you shouldn't be asking that sort of question.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I disapprove of near to every viewpoint expressed in it. The weakness, the grief, the crushing.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But still, I recognize that it is a book whose pages are soaked in blood.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: How would the writer describe the war we're seeing right now?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I'm as curious as you.
attributes.name: Manfred
